etymologies: mid 17th century (in the sense ‘relating to an affinity or paranormal influence’, as in sympathetic magic): from sympathy, on the pattern of pathetic

examples.text: he was sympathetic toward staff with family problems
he spoke in a sympathetic tone

definitions: showing approval of or favor toward an idea or action

examples.text: he was sympathetic to evolutionary ideas

shortDefinitions: showing approval of or favour towards idea or action

definitions: (of a person) attracting the liking of others

examples.text: Audrey develops as a sympathetic character

definitions: (of a structure) designed in a sensitive or fitting way

examples.text: buildings that were sympathetic to their surroundings

shortDefinitions: (of structure) designed in sensitive or appropriate way

definitions: relating to or denoting the part of the autonomic nervous system consisting of nerves arising from ganglia near the middle part of the spinal cord, supplying the internal organs, blood vessels, and glands, and balancing the action of the parasympathetic nerves.
shortDefinitions: of part of autonomic nervous system consisting of nerves arising from ganglia near middle part of spinal cord

definitions: relating to, producing, or denoting an effect which arises in response to a similar action elsewhere.
shortDefinitions: relating to, producing, or denoting effect which arises in response to similar action elsewhere
